Description: Pizzeria with a roomy, laid-back dining room serving deep-dish pies & other Italian eats.

parking: Somewhat difficult to find a space

summary.snippet: "Great service, nice restaurant, great food, and beers at a reasonable price."
"Three delicious pieces of fried fish, amazing chips and scrumptious Cole slaw"
"Great Service, friendly staff, enjoyed the Deep Dish Pizza."

most_relevant.description: Pizza House was a fantastic experience. I ordered a personal pepperoni Chicago style deep dish pizza and it was delicious and filling. It has a great atmosphere and it wasn't too busy on a Sunday at lunchtime. There were great beer options as well. It's also very close to the University of Michigan campus so we walked over there after we ate. Highly recommend!

I really enjoyed being here. The atmosphere is awesome and definitely a place to go when you want to watch a game or immerse yourself in the university environment. I heard great things about the feta bread, so I had to try it, and it exceeded my expectations. I may just come back here for it again. The pizza and wings I had were fine but not particularly memorable, but the feta bread was outstanding. I am definitely coming back to this place for a game day or just to enjoy the feta bread. If you’re in Ann Arbor and looking for a spot for a game day, to be immersed in the university environment, or if you just want some good cheese bread, definitely check this place out.
Great service, boneless wings are the best I've ever had, loved the thin crust pizza.
Sundried tomatoes cost $2.25 because they’re a "premium topping" and they were burnt. My gfs baked ziti with alfredo sauce was not baked at all.

Pizza House in Ann Arbor offers tasty food and decent service, but be prepared for a serious sticker shock. I recently dined there and was frankly floored by the final bill. We ordered two small vegetarian pizzas, a salad, and a kids' meal, which came to a staggering $123 after a 5% service charge was added. When we questioned our waitress about the price, she confirmed that a small vegetarian pizza was indeed $28. While the pizzas were good, they certainly weren't that good.

It's possible there was a mistake in the order entry. Perhaps we were charged for large pizzas instead of small or maybe a deep dish, or maybe there were some extra toppings added inadvertently. $28 for a small vegetarian pizza, even in a popular college town, seems incredibly high. I've dined at many pizzerias, and this price point is significantly higher than average for a basic vegetarian pizza, regardless of size.

The 5% service charge added to the bill also felt a bit unusual. While I appreciate restaurants ensuring their staff is compensated, adding a mandatory service charge feels a little sneaky. It certainly added to the overall feeling of being overcharged.

Setting aside the price, the food itself was enjoyable. The pizzas were well-made with fresh ingredients and a nicely cooked crust. The salad was fresh and crisp. Our waitress, despite the pricing confusion, was friendly and attentive throughout our meal. Unfortunately, we will probably never be back.
First time to AA and wanted to try the hot local spots and this was on the list.  I like the atmosphere, lots of options on pizzas and the service was great.  Very interactive pad for menu.

Great atmosphere, lousy inattentive service. Mediocre food. Digorno would be a far better choice by wide margins.
Celebrated a birthday there with 17 people. Toilet downstairs overflowing. Reported to staff they simply directed me to the upstairs restroom. Remained that way for two hours. Server disappeared at times for 15 minutes or more. Food came out of kitchen staggered by more than 20 minutes. Order accuracy was pathetic. I contacted store through website and received zero feedback.

Their pizzas, though a bit expensive, are unquestionably good. Especially enjoyed the Southern BBQ option and the House Special as always.
Really wanted to shout-out to their amazing lasagne which surprised our group! Such a rich and savory treat with great choice of cheese too! Loved every last bit of it.
